Job Title: Vacation Rental/HOA Property Manager 

Location: Isle of Palms, SC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Sales

Description:
Organization- Wild Dunes Resort

Summary

Join us for this incredible opportunity to be part of our Vacation Rental team as a Property Manager at Wild Dunes Resort located on the Isle of Palms, SC.!

We Offer Excellent Benefits:

 Complimentary room nights, Discounted and Friends & Family Room Rates  Medical, Prescription, Dental, and Vision Insurance  401K with company match  Paid Vacation, sick days, new child leave, and personal day  Paid Family Bonding Time and Adoption Assistance  Tuition Reimbursement  Discounted colleague meals during shift  Employee Stock Purchase Plan  Discounts at various retailers - Apple, AT&T, Verizon, Headspace, and many more 

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

 Inspect each vacation rental property for maintenance and housekeeping needs relating to hard goods, soft goods, furniture, fixtures, and appliances.  Maintain and review all owner financials.  Coordinate with housekeeping and maintenance management to address unit issues based on occupancy and seasonality.  Act as a liaison with community regime managers in matters affecting regime-controlled areas of owner property.  Interact and represent yourself as a leader of the resort.  Meet with owners while on the property to maintain positive relations.  Maintain monthly communication with owners as designated by the Director of Vacation Rental/Property Management.  Maintain accurate files for related correspondence.  Responsible for exterior/interior maintenance inspections for all homes and villas as applicable  Ongoing reporting and input data regarding both minor and major maintenance issues  Become knowledgeable of Wild Dunes unit standards and offer owners suggestions for upgrades.  Coordinate unit upgrades with homeowners, contractors, and staff  Assist owners with Resort operational concerns such as housekeeping and engineering.  Inspect potential new condos for program quality standards.  Required to be licensed or working on obtaining the license 

Qualifications

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION:

 Experience in resort-orientated property management or the hospitality industry is preferred.  At least two years of supervisory experience required.  Must have or working towards a PMIC License. 

 JOB REQUIREMENTS: 

 Must be authorized to work in the United States  Must be able to read, write and speak English.  Must have a solid working knowledge of Microsoft Office programs.  Must be professional in appearance and demeanor.  Must always ensure a teamwork environment.  Ability to work a flexible schedule that may include evenings, weekends, and holidays (40-50 hrs p/wk) 

 WORKING CONDITIONS: 

 Must be able to stand on feet throughout the shift, with intermittent periods of walking.  Must be able to perform simple grasping, fine manipulation, repetitive hand & arm movements frequently, and squeezing & overhead reaching occasionally.  Must be able to bend, squat, crawl, kneel, push, pull, and walk on uneven surfaces on an occasional basis.  While primarily an indoor job, one must be able to walk outside in a variety of weather conditions (rain, wind, heat)  Must be able to climb stairs occasionally, both indoors and outside, in a variety of weather conditions (rain, wind, heat)

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
